title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
content:
Have you seen this movie yet?
I think its one of the best movies ever!
The music was funny, and the main theme (in the very beginning) is really cool.
It was SO funny, one of the funniest movies i've ever seen.

Compared to the original movie (and even the book!), the others look like cheap imitations! This was such a good movie.

title: well...
content: I did not like Depp as Wonka.  I liked the childrens' portrayals of their roles, and thought Burton did a fabulous job helping us hate all the kids who got their Golden Tickets.  The Oompa Loompas I thought were nicely done--it was comical that they were all based off of the same individual, and it was interesting to note that Elfman did all their voices (similar to Ilsoap doing all the voices for his Shadowlands cartoons)... but really, I couldn't get over how much I disliked Depp as Wonka.

title: Decent
content:
Whlie not the greatest movie I've ever seen, it was certainly the first I've seen at the cinema this year (Meet the Fockers[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] , XXX2[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] and War of the Worlds among them) that didn't have me questioning whether I should have forked out $8.50 for it (or completely certain I shouldn't) after leaving the cinema. Certainly a refreshing change.

The Oompah-Loompahs could have been more interesting. Animated CG characters would have been better instead of clones of a single actor, IMKO. Additionally, the songs didn't live up to the classics, but I guess that's the price you pay for a one-size-fits-all production.

On the whole it seemed much more surreal and vivid than the first movie, and I quite enjoyed the expanded focus on Wonka's psychology, along with the much more thorough ending. Great, as far as the mainstream goes.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani
